musicalLanguage.description: The iconic Mexican folk song, made internationally famous by Ritchie Valens. Built on just three chords (C, F, G), it is one of the most energetic and accessible songs for beginners. The driving rhythm and simple chord pattern create infectious energy. The left hand drives the rhythm while the right hand plays the joyful, bouncing melody.
musicalLanguage.structure: Repeating C-F-G7 vamp (8 bars with increasing energy)
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: The three-chord vamp establishes the groove immediately.
Bars 5-6: Melody becomes more active — the dance is in full swing.
Bar 8: The final turnaround — sets up the endless repeat.
teachingGoals: Three-chord song — C, F, G — the most important chords in music
Building energy through repetition and dynamics
styleTips: Energetic and joyful — this is a dance song, play it like one
Keep the rhythm driving forward — never drag
Accent beat 1 of each measure to keep the groove anchored

measures.teachingNote: C major — bouncy and bright. The energy starts high.
F to G — the classic I-IV-V. Keep bouncing.
C major — add the G4 to the riff. Slightly bigger each pass.
F to G — B4 at the end leads back to C. Exciting turnaround.
C major — melody jumps to C5. The dance is in full swing.
F to G — melody bounces between chord tones. Keep it lively.
C major — descending arpeggio. Building to the final bar.
F-G-C — the final tag. Land on C with conviction.
